snippet: A company’s stock can rocket even as its operations are being run into the ground. But how else to link a chief’s pay to performance?
abstract: Gretchen Morgenson Fair Game column discusses analysis of executive pay based on returns on capital for top 200 companies; notes results indicate 74 percent of chief executives were overpaid in 2015; highlights industries that tend to overcompensate, as well as companies that have leaders who are delivering outsize returns on capital for fair and even undersize pay.
lead_paragraph: A company’s stock can rocket even as its operations are being run into the ground. But how else to link a chief’s pay to performance?

headline.print_headline: Gauging the Value of a C.E.O.
headline.main: How to Gauge a C.E.O.’s Value? Hint: It’s Not the Share Price
